entry.title: Vale – Bob Mouatt (OAM)
entry.summary: Orienteering Australia is saddened to learn of the passing of one of our former Presidents in Bob. Bob was a true icon of our sport. He was a leader, promoter, communicator, manager, organiser, planner, controller, competitor, and mentor. Bob gave so much to our sport as a passionate member of Orienteering ACT and with Orienteering Australia. Vale – Bob Mouatt (OAM) first appeared on Orienteering Australia.

entry.title: JWOC Long distance: Bührer wins second gold, Czech reign in W20
entry.summary: There was total Czech dominance in the women’s class as the Junior World Orienteering Championships field went into the forest today for the long distance, where Switzerland’s Matthieu Bührer took the title for the second consecutive day in the men’s class. After two days of sprint races, Wednesday offered a completely different challenge for the […]

entry.title: Oceania NZ 2025 Embargoes
entry.summary: Everyone intending to enter the Oceania Orienteering Championships 24-27 January 2025 needs to be aware of the embargoes in place for the event. Embargoes are areas that are out of bounds to competitors prior to the events, and cover the areas being used in the competition. This prevents unfair prior knowledge being gained about the […] Oceania NZ 2025 Embargoes first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: World Orienteering Championships 2024 – team announcement

entry.title: JWOC: Shared sprint gold in W20, narrow Swiss win in M20
entry.summary: The teams and spectators at the Junior World Orienteering Championship in Czechia saw a thrilling sprint race on Tuesday, where Elli Punto (FIN) and Michaela Novotna (CZE) tied for the gold in the women’s class, and Switzerland’s Matthieu Bührer won by two seconds in the men’s. Today’s sprint took place in the historic city centre […]

entry.title: Podcast: Eef van Dongen on WOC in Scotland and her Knock-Out Sprint bronze from Denmark in 2022
entry.summary: With only four years of orienteering experience, Eef van Dongen (NED) took the orienteering world by surprise, when she won the bronze medal as Knock-Out Sprint made its debut on the WOC-program in Denmark in 2022. In this podcast episode, she shares her memories from the day and look ahead to the upcoming World Orienteering […]

entry.title: JWOC: Norway took clear Sprint Relay win
entry.summary: Norway took the first gold medal at the Junior World Orienteering Championships, which began on Monday afternoon with a sprint relay in the western part of Pilsen city, Czechia. An impressive 77 teams were ready at the starting line at 16.15, when the championships were kicked off in front of an enthusiastic audience. Today’s arena […]

entry.summary: With the deadline passing for appeals for this year’s Southern Cross Teams, ONZ is happy to officially confirm teams and management below. A second invoice will be sent closer to departure, with a final invoice after the trip’s return to […] Southern Cross Teams are now official first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: EYOC 2024
entry.summary: The Irish Junior Team recently took part in the 2024 European Youth Orienteering Championships, held in Szczecin, Poland from June 21st – June 24th. entry.title: World Cup |Round Two, Genoa Italy | 1-2 June
entry.summary: Sprint – 1 JuneTim tackled a challenging map in the individual sprint race with composure, pushing hard to secure 7th place. The race began with a highly technical garden section and a steep hill, descending into the older town buildings. Amber noted similarities to the Wellington Botanic Gardens map at the start, while Laura appreciated […] World Cup |Round Two, Genoa Italy | 1-2 June first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: EYOC |Szcezecin, Poland | 22-24 June
entry.summary: From June 22nd to 24th, fourteen young New Zealand athletes travelled to Poland to participate in the European Youth Orienteering Championships. On Saturday, June 22nd, the competition kicked off with the long-distance event. Rachel Baker and Tide Fa’avae both achieved commendable results, placing 18th and 20th respectively in the W18 category. entry.title: King’s Birthday Weekend| Nelson Orienteering Club
entry.summary: King’s Birthday Weekend saw over 450 participants tackle the ‘Middle’ event at Canaan Downs, in tricky, highly technical terrain. Planner Amelia Horne and controller Calum Coombs had made most of the rolling farmland and moderate to fast open beech forest with intricate karst topography, numerous tomos and marble rock outcrops, resulting in a lot of […] King’s Birthday Weekend| Nelson Orienteering Club first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.summary: Join us in the summer of 2025 for an unforgettable orienteering adventure through the stunning sand dunes and pines of the Manawatū. entry.title: Australian Orienteering Championship Carnival 2024 | AOC 24

entry.title: NZ Secondary Schools Orienteering Champs | 19 -21 July
entry.summary: Orienteering Wellington is looking forward to welcoming all year 7-13 orienteers from across New Zealand to the Wellington region for three days of high-quality orienteering from the 19th-21st July 2024. Join us and showcase your navigational skills, support your friends and create lasting memories in unique terrain. The events are located north of Wellington, towards the Kapiti Coast.All […] NZ Secondary Schools Orienteering Champs | 19 -21 July first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Manawatū Schools Relay | 2 August
entry.summary: The Manawatū Schools Relay Champs will be August 2nd. Let your school know to plan the teams. Students run in teams of 3. Online entries close 24 July. The event fee is $5 each including ident hire. Categories: year 5/6, 7/8 boys/ girls and secondary girls / boys. For more details email Manawatū Schools Relay | 2 August first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Short history of orienteering in New Zealand | 50 years
entry.summary: Last year marked our 50th anniversary, and Bryan Teehan compiled a special booklet for the occasion. Meanwhile, Stuart Payne wearing a moonboot, was easily persuaded to update our 40-year-old history and extend it by another decade. The resulting 52-page document commemorates the 50th Anniversary of ONZ (formerly NZOF). When asked about the task of adding […] Short history of orienteering in New Zealand | 50 years first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Southern Cross Challenge Update
entry.summary: Team SelectionSelectors have published this year’s Southern Cross Team which will be officially approved shortly subject to ONZ’s appeal deadlines passing. It is the first time in a number of years that […] Southern Cross Challenge Update first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Orienteers in GodZone documentary | NZ Mountain Film Festival
entry.summary: Orienteers in GodZone documentary | NZ Mountain Film Festival The Adventure of Racing follows is a documentary of a female-led adventure racing team. entry.title: ONZ’s Board approve new HP staffing structure
entry.summary: Following the retirement of long-serving ONZ Performance Leader Malcolm Ingham earlier in the year, ONZ’s Board reached out to key stakeholders to review how High Performance (HP) should be staffed over the next five years. The group included current and form elite athletes, coaches, Board Members, current and former Club Presidents and a Regional Development […] ONZ’s Board approve new HP staffing structure first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.summary: The International Orienteering Federation is still well on its way to achieving its goals for lowering climate emissions. entry.title: Event Advisers’ Clinic in Canada from August 12-13
entry.summary: IOF’s FootO Commission organise an Event Advisers’ Clinic in Ottawa, Canada from August 12-13, 2024. Deadline for entries is June 30th. Go to the full invitation here.
